title: Customize dependencies example on the home page is no longer valid
body:
I was training one of my users to use `spack` and think I found a documentation bug.  I was explaining to my user about changing variants of dependencies, because that was a necessary step to get their package running.

But in the home page https://spack.io under the section "Customize dependencies" the `libdwarf` package has no `debug` variant to enable.  In fact, `libdwarf` has no variants at all that can be changed.  

1. The "Customize dependencies" example should be replaced with a valid example.
2. It might be nice if the example can be rolled into the section above it on 
"Custom versions & configurations" so that it doesn't break the flow of reading?  For example one could tack on something like:

```bash
# Link with specific versions of openmpi and hwloc
$ spack install hdf5@1.10.1 ^openmpi +cuda fabrics=auto ^hwloc +gl
```

If you like I can submit a PR for the above change, but I can't find know where the source code for the https://spack.io home page is located.  I'm not seeing it easily in the main repo and don't know what magic you use to create it; as far as I can tell, the home page rendering is not tied into Travis CI?

### Steps to reproduce the issue

Visit https://spack.io/ and scroll down to "Customize dependencies" to show the `libdarf` example.  Try to explain variants with `spack find ...` but Variants is None.

### Error Message

```console
$ spack info libdwarf
--snip--
Variants:
    None
--snip--
```

### Information on your system

```console
$ spack arch
linux-rhel6-x86_64
```

I posted this question on the `#general` channel on Slack and [advised by Todd Gamblin](https://spackpm.slack.com/archives/C5W7NKZJT/p1564556618131500) to open an issue.
